questions.question: Which is a condition for the existence of a monopoly?
questions.explanation: A monopoly exists when a single firm produces a product with no close substitutes, giving it market power.

questions.question: Price elasticity of demand for normal goods is always:
questions.explanation: Price elasticity of demand is negative for all goods (normal and inferior) because of the inverse price‑quantity relationship, though we often refer to its absolute value.

questions.question: If the demand for a commodity is inelastic, an increase in its price will cause the total expenditure of the consumers of the commodity to:
questions.explanation: When demand is inelastic, the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is smaller than the percentage increase in price, so total expenditure (price × quantity) rises.

questions.question: Which one of the following is the condition of equilibrium for the monopolist?
questions.explanation: A monopolist maximizes profit by producing where marginal revenue (MR) equals marginal cost (MC). Unlike perfect competition, price is greater than MR and MC.
